maml:description.maml:para: Expands a compressed archive or container.
Expands a compressed archive or container.

Currently only ZIP files are supported. Per default the contents of the ZIP is expanded in the current directory. If an item already exists, you will be visually prompted to overwrite it, skip it, or to have a second copy of the item exanded. This is due to the mechanism how this is implemented (via Shell.Application).

Specifies the archive to expand. You can either pass this parameter as a path and name to the archive or as a FileInfo object. You can also pass an array of archives to the parameter. In addition you can pipe a single archive or an array of archives to this parameter as well.
Specifies the destination path where to expand the archive. By default this is the current directory.

Specifies the archive to expand. You can either pass this parameter as a path and name to the archive or as a FileInfo object. You can also pass an array of archives to the parameter. In addition you can pipe a single archive or an array of archives to this parameter as well.
Specifies the destination path where to expand the archive. By default this is the current directory.
InputObject can either be a full path to an archive or a FileInfo object. In addition it can also be an array of these objects.
Path expects a directory or a DirectoryInfo object.
This Cmdlet has no return value.

maml:alert.maml:para: See module manifest for required software versions and dependencies at: http://dfch.biz/biz/dfch/PS/System/Utilities/biz.dfch.PS.System.Utilities.psd1/

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Expands an archive 'mydata.zip' to the current directory.
Expand-CompressedItem mydata.zip

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Expands an archive 'mydata.zip' to the current directory and prompts for every item to be extracted.
Expand-CompressedItem mydata.zip -Confirm

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-ChildItem Y:\Source\*.zip | Expand-CompressedItem -Path Z:\Destination -Format ZIP -Confirm
You can also pipe archives to the Cmdlet. Enumerate all ZIP files in 'Y:\Source' and pass them to the Cmdlet. Each item to be extracted must be confirmed.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Expands archives 'data1.zip' and 'data2.zip' to the current directory.
Expand-CompressedItem "Y:\Source\data1.zip","Y:\Source\data2.zip"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Expands archives 'data1.zip' and 'data2.zip' to the current directory.
@("Y:\Source\data1.zip","Y:\Source\data2.zip") | Expand-CompressedItem

maml:description.maml:para: Formats a File or a string containing XML in pretty-printed (indented) format.
Formats a File or a string containing XML in pretty-printed (indented) format.
This Cmdlet takes a string or a file object and converts the input to an XML indented output. The input remains unmodified.
Specifies an path to a file containing XML.
Specifies an path to a file containing XML.
The Cmdlet returns a string containing the XML pretty-printed output.

maml:alert.maml:para: See module manifest for required software versions and dependencies at: http://dfch.biz/biz/dfch/PS/System/Utilities/biz.dfch.PS.System.Utilities.psd1/

dev:remarks.maml:para: Formats a XML object from a string input

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: [xml] $xml = "<xmlroot><node id='1'>Node 1</node><node id='2'>Node 2</node></xmlroot>" $xml.OuterXml | Out-File Y:\data\data.xml Format-Xml -File Y:\data\xml.xml
